students.name: Kamalani Brun
students.background: Kamalani Brun is a writer, marketing manager and student/graduate of Dev-Island's coding bootcamp. Kamalani has experience writing website copy, novels, and educational content for curriculums. Kamalani graduated from Western Washington University with a bachelor's degree in Environmental Studies with minors in Geography and Disaster Risk Reduction.
students.statement: As a local creative, I feel incredibly lucky to have been afforded the opportunity to add this skillset to my repertoire. While writing is my passion, I value all forms of storytelling and, more than anything, the ability to fulfill a need in my community.

students.name: Christian Faber
students.background: Christian grew up on the mainland, eventually going to college to study Economics and International Business at Drake University. After some time living abroad in Europe and South America, Christian secured a position on Kauaʻi working with data analytics and visualization. This led to Christian starting his own business, Community Pursuit, where he continues to work with information and data.
students.statement: I've been having a lot of fun with everything! I feel accomplished whenever I get a component to work or finish a project!

team.name: Rich Uhl
team.background: Rich Uhl is an experienced technology executive passionate about building—teams, and solutions. Rich is the Founder and CTO of 1Strategy, Amazon Web Services (AWS) experts and implementation partners. Founded in July of 2015, Rich grew the 1Strategy to become an AWS Premier Partner (only 75 partners among 100,000+). In October of 2019, Rich sold 1Strategy to TEKsystems Global Services, a global IT services company. Rich will focus on business development and partnerships.

team.name: AJ Webb
team.background: AJ Webb is a software engineer with over 10 years of experience in the industry. He is currently working as a principal software engineer at Provenance Blockchain Foundation. He has also worked as a principal software engineer at Figure and as an advisory board member. He has previously served as a manager of frontend engineering at SoFi, a tutor in web development at Practicum by Yandex, a mentor and curriculum creator at Thinkful, a frontend manager and architect at iCentris, a frontend team lead at O.C. Tanner, a senior software engineer at Vivint, a lead JavaScript developer at Slipstone Inc, and a UI developer at ACTIVE Network. He has also been a co-founder of several startups such as Payba.cc, Wehl Media, and Dev-Island. He has expertise in web development and blockchain technology. He holds a Bachelor of Science degree in Digital Media from Utah Valley University. He is also a volunteer at CODE CLUB WORLD LTD and an Hour of Code volunteer at Code.org. AJ is a proud Hawaii resident and lives and works from the island of Kaua'i. AJ will serve on the Board of Directors and will lead the technical education of the students.

team.name: Danielle Steed
team.background: Danielle Steed received a bachelor’s degree in education. She has experience at the university level as a Graduate Program Manager. In addition to her passion for continued education, she has worked with several technology startups, including 1Strategy, a Premier AWS Consulting company. Over the last 5 years she has grown her knowledge and love for technology. Danielle will focus on business development.

team.name: Kamalani Brun
team.background: Kamalani Brun is a writer, marketing manager and student/graduate of Dev-Island's coding bootcamp. Kamalani has experience writing website copy, novels, and educational content for curriculums. Kamalani graduated from Western Washington University with a bachelor's degree in Environmental Studies with minors in Geography and Disaster Risk Reduction.
team.statement: Dev-Island has offered us the space to not only look at how we can improve our professional skills, but how we can improve ourselves. The community we've created has acted as a mirror for many of us. We've had no choice but to think about the 'why' in every aspect of our lives and that's a beautiful thing.

team.name: Natalia Alvarez
team.background: Natalia Alvarez was born & raised on the beautiful island of Kauaʻi. Her experience in digital marketing, social media, video content creation, and business presents an opportunity to add value and change lives in her hometown and community. New to the Dev-Island team, she holds an immense passion for helping others grow, activate their potential, and best selves.

team.name: Jason Bryant
team.background: Jason Bryant is an experienced Systems Engineer with over a decade of IT, Radar, RF Communications and Cybersecurity experience. He is a subject matter export in cybersecurity architecture, government architecture standards and Agile methodologies. He is comfortable in performing requirements analysis, designing system architecture and MBSE. Jason’s education is highly focused on IT and business management.  His BS is in Network Administration and Integrated Computing Systems. Born and raised on the westside of Kauai, Jason is an active member of his local community.  As a local business owner, father, and coach he is committed to investing into the island that raised him. Jason will serve on the Board of Directors.

team.name: Keoni Pau
team.background: Keoni Pau is an experienced educator currently teaching at Chiefess Kamakahelei Middle School. His classes range from STEM to Hawaiiana classes. Keoni was born and raised on Kauai and prior to his position at Chiefess he taught for several years at Koloa Elementary School. Keoni will serve on the board of directors.

team.name: David Dooley
team.background: Dave is an education administrator with over twenty years combined experience in university and secondary education environments including: leadership, administration, supervision, program management, curriculum development, mentoring, teaching, and coaching. Dave is proficient in working with, and coaching in, a variety of leadership styles. Dave will serve on the board of directors.
